com.reelyactive.blesdk.application

Class ReelyAwareApplicationCallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.reelyactive.blesdk.application.ReelyAwareApplicationCallback
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.app.Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks, BleServiceCallback

    public abstract class ReelyAwareApplicationCallback
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.app.Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks, BleServiceCallback
    This class provides a convenient way to make your application aware of any Reelceivers.

    Register it using Application.registerActivityLifecycleCallbacks(Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks)

    Extend it to customize the behaviour of your application.

    The default behaviour is to bind to the BleService as soon as the app is created.

    See Also:
    Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks

      • onActivityResumed

        public void onActivityResumed(android.app.Activity activity)
        The default behaviour is to check if a ReelyAwareActivity is running, and call a scan if so.
        See startScan() and getScanType()
        Specified by:
        onActivityResumed in interface android.app.Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks
        Parameters:
        activity - The resumed Activity

      • shouldStartScan

        protected boolean shouldStartScan()
        Called by the class in order to check if a scan should be started.
        Override this method if you need to change the behaviour of the scan.
        Returns:
        true if the conditions for a scan are present, false otherwise.

      • hasScanPermissions

        protected boolean hasScanPermissions()

      • onBleEvent

        public boolean onBleEvent(BleService.Event event,
                          java.lang.Object data)
        This method is called when a BleService.Event is received.
        Its default behaviour is to notify the currently running ReelyAwareActivity (if any).
        Override this and you can customize the behaviour of the application.
        Specified by:
        onBleEvent in interface BleServiceCallback
        Parameters:
        event - The BleService.Event received from the BleService.
        Returns:
        true if the event was processed, false otherwise;
